info.description:
The endpoints described here are routed through Adobe.io. 
								In order to use these endpoints you must create an oAuth client that is 
								subscribed to access the Adobe Analytics Reporting API.
info.title: Analytics Services APIs

tags.name: dateranges
tags.description: Retrieves a dateranges for the Given Report Suite

tags.name: metrics
tags.description: Retrieves a List of Metrics for the Given Report Suite

tags.name: segments
tags.description: These operations manage Adobe Analytics Segments. Segments are used to isolate interesting groups of visitors, visits, or hits.

get.summary: Retrieve many calculated metrics
get.description:
A calculated metric response will always include these default items: *id, name, description, rsid, owner* 

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field:

* *modified*: Date that the metric was last modified (ISO 8601)
* *definition*: Calculated metric definition as JSON object
* *compatibility*: Products that the metric is compatible with
* *reportSuiteName*: Also return the friendly Report Suite name for the RSID
* *favorite*: True if calculated metric has been marked as a 'Favorite'
* *tags*: Gives all existing tags associated with the calculated metric
* *approved*: True if calculated metric has been marked as 'Approved'
* *shares*: Gives all existing shares for the calculated metric
* *sharesFullName*: Give 'shares', but also include the shared-to user's friendly login name as 'shareToDisplayName' in each share object
* *ownerFullName*: Add friendly full login name (string) to the 'owner' object

parameters.name: rsids
parameters.description: Filter list to only include calculated metrics tied to specified RSID list (comma-delimited)

parameters.name: ownerId
parameters.description: Filter list to only include calculated metrics owned by the specified loginId

parameters.name: calculatedMetricFilter
parameters.description: Filter list to only include calculated metrics in the specified list (comma-delimited list of IDs)

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter list to only include calculated metrics that contains the Name

parameters.name: tagNames
parameters.description: Filter list to only include calculated metrics that contains one of the tags

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results per page

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number (base 0 - first page is "0")

parameters.name: expansion
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of additional calculated metric metadata fields to include on response.

400.description: Unable to retrieve list of calculated metrics shared with user

401.description: Owner filter error; user specified is not in the same company as the requesting user

403.description: Requesting non-shared calculated metrics for other users is restricted to admin users

500.description: External API error; Calculated metric retrieval failed

get.summary: Retrieve a single calculated metric by id
get.description:
A calculated metric response will always include these default items: *id, name, description, rsid, owner* 

Other attributes can be optionally requested through the 'expansion' field:

* *modified*: Date that the metric was last modified (ISO 8601)
* *definition*: Calculated metric definition as JSON object
* *compatibility*: Products that the metric is compatible with
* *reportSuiteName*: Also return the friendly Report Suite name for the RSID
* *favorite*: True if calculated metric has been marked as a 'Favorite'
* *tags*: Gives all existing tags associated with the calculated metric
* *approved*: True if calculated metric has been marked as 'Approved'
* *shares*: Gives all existing shares for the calculated metric
* *sharesFullName*: Give 'shares', but also include the shared-to user's friendly login name as 'shareToDisplayName' in each share object
* *ownerFullName*: Add friendly full login name (string) to the 'owner' object

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The calculated metric ID to retrieve

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale

parameters.name: expansion
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of additional calculated metric metadata fields to include on response.

403.description: Requesting non-shared calculated metrics for other users is restricted to admin users

500.description: External API error; calculated metric retrieval failed

get.summary: Returns a list of dimensions for a given report suite.

parameters.name: rsid
parameters.description: A Report Suite ID

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale

parameters.name: segmentable
parameters.description: Only include dimensions that are valid within a segment.

parameters.name: reportable
parameters.description: Only include dimensions that are valid within a report.

parameters.name: classifiable
parameters.description: Only include classifiable dimensions.

parameters.name: expansion
parameters.description: Add extra metadata to items (comma-delimited list)

401.description: User does not have access to this report suite

parameters.name: expansion
parameters.description: Add extra metadata to items (comma-delimited list)

get.summary: Returns a list of metrics for the given report suite
get.description: This returns the metrics list primarily for the Analytics product. The platform identity API Returns a list of all possible metrics for the supported systems.

parameters.name: rsid
parameters.description: ID of desired report suite ie. sistr2

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale that system named metrics should be returned in

parameters.name: segmentable
parameters.description: Filter the metrics by if they are valid in a segment.

parameters.name: expansion
parameters.description: Add extra metadata to items (comma-delimited list)

400.description: Invalid input; name, rsid, and definition are all required. Definition must be formatted as a JSON Object.

rsid.description: The report suite id for which the component was created/updated

reportSuiteName.description: The report suite name for which the component was created/updated

polarity.description: Set metric polarity, which indicates whether it's good or bad if a given metric goes up. Default=positive

precision.description: Number of decimal places to include in calculated metric result

id.description: A UUID that will be generated when a column is created.

name.description: The name for this given data column. Immutable after column creation. Can be any valid UTF-8 string.

displayName.description: The display name for this given data column. Mutable. Can be any valid UTF-8 string.

type.description: Defaults to 'text'. Immutable after column creation.

classifiedBy.description: An optional classification dataset id, whose dataset classifies this column's data.

tags.description: Internal column tags. Used to store info (like div nums) to support taxonomist migration.

rsid.description: The report suite id for which the component was created/updated

reportSuiteName.description: The report suite name for which the component was created/updated

parentRsid.description: Parent report suite id for virtual report suite

reportSuiteName.description: The friendly name for the report suite id.

owner.description: The owner of the segment as an Owner object.

isDeleted.description: Whether or not the segment is 'Deleted' (deleted segments are only returned if requested by id)

dwInUse.description: Whether or not the segment currently in use in a Data Warehouse request. A Data Warehouse request is another type of report that clients can run based on their raw data

asiInUse.description: Whether or not the segment currently in use in an ASI (old version of VSR) slot.

aamStatus.description: AAM/Raven publishing status (cross-product segment sharing). A segment can be published to AAM, and this flag indicates whether the segment has been published to AAM.

definition.description: The segment definition as a JSON object

compatibility.description: Analytics products that the segment is compatible with

legacyId.description: Legacy segment id from old segment database (only exists if the segment was migrated from the old segment DB)

template.description: Whether or not the segment is a template.  A template is a predefined segment that can be used by all customers and can not be edited

dataGroup.description: The data group of the segment

virtualReportSuites.description: A list of all Virtual Report Suites that are using this segment.

tags.description: All existing tags associated with the segment.

favorite.description: Whether or not the segment has been marked as a favorite.

approved.description: Whether or not the segment has been marked approved.

usageSummary.description: How frequently the user uses this segment.

siteTitle.description: A name for the report suite.  This is deprecated and should use the report suite name instead.

id.description: System generated virtual report suite id

rsid.description: The report suite id for which the component was created/updated

reportSuiteName.description: The report suite name for which the component was created/updated

parentRsid.description: Parent report suite id for virtual report suite

segmentList.description: List of segments applied to this virtual report suite

jobOptions.description: see POST /classifications/dataset/{id}/jobs/import and POST /classifications/dataset/{id}/jobs/export for details on this data model

id.description: This value will be auto generated by the system on creation. This value will be a id in the form of an ObjectId.

imsOrgId.description: This value will be looked up based on the analytics company of the user.

name.description: A human readable display name for users to be able to easily identify this classification definition.

description.description: A long description for the purpose of this classification set.

defaultListDelimiter.description: Default delimiter for list column types. Defaults to "," (comma). If you have no list columns this field does not apply.

defaultEncoding.description: Default encoding for jobs. Defaults to UTF-8.

columns.description: A list of classification column definitions. Column definitions are not required at the time of creation but no data will be classified until at least one column definition exists.

subscriptions.description: A list of classification subscriptions. Subscriptions are not required at the time of creation but no data will be classified until at least one subscription exists.

owner.description: Contact information for a person responsible for the classification definition and/or data.

lastModifiedBy.description: Email address of the last person that modified the classification set.

lastModifiedDate.description: Last modified date/time of the classification set.

notifications.description: List of notifications to be sent for all imports and exports that occur.

ftpSettings.description: Ftp settings for the classification set.

editable.description: Flag to indicate if the classification set is editable by the current user based on report suite permissions.

rsid.description: The report suite id for which you would like to subscribe to a classification set.

dimension.description: The dimension identity you would like to be classified. Should be prefixed with variables/ i.e. variables/page

editable.description: Flag to indicate if the subscription is editable by the current user based on report suite permissions.

id.description: the login id of the owner

name.description: the friendly full login name of the owner, included when the expansion parameter ownerFullName is true

login.description: the friendly full login name of the owner, included when the expansion parameter ownerFullName is true

parentRsid.description: Parent report suite id for virtual report suite

components.description: the list of components that have been tagged with this tag
